comments:
This used to work on Eclipse 3.0.1 but now fails on 3.1.
There are four JUnit test failures in the JEM tests. They all seem related in
that they are inner classes in the default package and the assertion statement is:
	assertSame(TypeKind.CLASS_LITERAL, pdType.getKind());
pdType.getKind() returns UNDEFINED instead of CLASS. 
While debugging, the culprit seems to be JDT's
NameLookup#seekTypesInSourcePackage which was changed quite a bit 3.1.
For 3.0.1 is sets the sourceType for the read adapter which is
JavaClassJDOMAdapter. In 3.1, the sourceType is null because JDT fails to find
it so the assertion fails. 
Not sure if this is JDT bug or JEM needs to change to work properly with this
but this warrants further investigation. I found a JDT bug that might be similar
but I'm not sure (bug 83500).

Needs to be fixed for 1.1M1.
BTW... NameLookup#seekTypesInSourcePackage in Eclipse 3.1 has been changed quite
a bit compared to Eclipse 3.0.1.

The failures occurred in TestReflection and TestStandard.

Here's one of the stack traces from the JUnit test:
